history.content: Hmm, so I'm not sure the best way to learn MATLAB is with a tutor.  The syntax is pretty friendly, especially if you've used Python extensively (like you do in the 61A).  I'd take a look at this before you make a decision on a tutor:  https://www.tutorialspoint.com/matlab/matlab_syntax.htm

Hmm, so I'm not sure the best way to learn MATLAB is with a tutor.  The syntax is pretty straightforward, especially if you've used Python extensively (like you do in the 61A).  I'd take a look at this before you make a decision on a tutor:  https://www.tutorialspoint.com/matlab/matlab_syntax.htm

children.subject: It honestly seems like a pretty bad idea to take E7 just to learn Matlab if you've already taken 61 series. Matlab is a pretty easy language to learn, and it's very similar to python/numpy; it shouldn't take you more than a week or two to familiarize yourself with the language.

history.content:
Hi everyone,

I am going to be taking E7 next semester because I need to know some matlab for my upcoming internship this summer. I am looking for someone who can tutor  me in matlab next semester so that I can get some background with it. I have already taken the 61 series so I am mainly focused on learning the language itself. If you think you would be able to do this or you know someone who could tutor me, please contact me at veragold@berkeley.edu. Thanks so much!
history.subject: Matlab Tutor
